content: MAXUSERS=1000 00002 MAXDISKS=500 00003 DDNAME=CONTROL VDEV=301 00004 DDNAME=LOG1 VDEV=302 00005 DDNAME=LOG2 VDEV=303 00006 DDNAME=BACKUP DISK FN=FILEPOOL FT=BACKUP FM=* 00007 DDNAME=MDK00001 VDEV=304 GROUP=1 BLOCKS=0 00008 DDNAME=MDK00002 VDEV=305 GROUP=2 BLOCKS=0 D 009 DDNAME=CRR1 VDEV=306 D 010 DDNAME=CRR2 VDEV=307 00011 * * * End of File * * * ====> X E D I T 1 File 242 Virtualization Cookbook: Vol 1: IBM z/VM 7.2 6.16.4 Adding a directory entry for the SFS administration machine The LNXMAINT virtual machine now must be created. LNXMAINT owns and maintains the LNX SFS file pool. Complete the following steps: 1. Create the entry and then, send it to DirMaint for processing: ===> xedit lnxmaint direct a You see the information that is shown in Figure 6-23. Figure 6-23 Entry created and sent to DirMaint for processing ===> dirmaint add lnxmaint ... DVHREQ2289I Your ADD request for LNXMAINT at * has completed; with RC=0 2. Use LOGONBY to log on to LNXMAINT. During IPL, you might
